distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for sqlite is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
SQLite is a C library that implements an SQL database engine. A large subset of SQL92 is supported. A complete database is stored in a single disk file. The API is designed for convenience and ease of use. Applications that link against SQLite can enjoy the power and flexibility of an SQL database without the administrative hassles of supporting a separate database server.

Security Fix(es):

* sqlite: Use-after-free in window function leading to remote code execution (CVE-2019-5018)

* sqlite: Division by zero in whereLoopAddBtreeIndex in sqlite3.c (CVE-2019-16168)

* sqlite: selectExpander in select.c proceeds with WITH stack unwinding even after a parsing error (CVE-2019-20218)

* sqlite: Out-of-bounds read in SELECT with ON/USING clause (CVE-2020-6405)

* sqlite: NULL pointer dereference and segmentation fault because of generated column optimizations (CVE-2020-9327)

* sqlite: Use-after-free in fts3EvalNextRow in ext/fts3/fts3.c (CVE-2020-13630)

* sqlite: Virtual table can be renamed into the name of one of its shadow tables (CVE-2020-13631)

* sqlite: NULL pointer dereference in ext/fts3/fts3_snippet.c via a crafted matchinfo() query (CVE-2020-13632)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: sqlite security update

notes.text: An exploitable use after free vulnerability exists in the window function functionality of Sqlite3 3.26.0. A specially crafted SQL command can cause a use after free vulnerability, potentially resulting in remote code execution. An attacker can send a malicious SQL command to trigger this vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: Use-after-free in window function leading to remote code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of sqlite as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, and 7 as they did not include support for Window functions.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: Use-after-free in window function leading to remote code execution

notes.text: In SQLite through 3.29.0, whereLoopAddBtreeIndex in sqlite3.c can crash a browser or other application because of missing validation of a sqlite_stat1 sz field, aka a "severe division by zero in the query planner."
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: Division by zero in whereLoopAddBtreeIndex in sqlite3.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The SQLite package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and previous versions are not affected by this flaw. The bug was introduced on sqlite-3.8.5 while Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and previous releases ships sqlite <= 3.7.17.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: Division by zero in whereLoopAddBtreeIndex in sqlite3.c

notes.text: selectExpander in select.c in SQLite 3.30.1 proceeds with WITH stack unwinding even after a parsing error.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: selectExpander in select.c proceeds with WITH stack unwinding even after a parsing error
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: selectExpander in select.c proceeds with WITH stack unwinding even after a parsing error

notes.text: An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in the SQLite component of the Chromium browser. A remote attacker could abuse this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: Out-of-bounds read in SELECT with ON/USING clause
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw did not affect the versions of SQLite as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6 and 7 as they did not include the WHERE-clause constant propagation optimization, which was introduced in a later version of the package.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: Out-of-bounds read in SELECT with ON/USING clause

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference was found in SQLite in the way it executes select statements with column optimizations. An attacker who is able to execute SQL statements can use this flaw to crash the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: NULL pointer dereference and segmentation fault because of generated column optimizations
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: NULL pointer dereference and segmentation fault because of generated column optimizations

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the SQLite FTS3 extension module in the way it implemented the snippet function. This flaw allows an attacker who can execute SQL statements to crash the application or potentially execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: Use-after-free in fts3EvalNextRow in ext/fts3/fts3.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw did not affect the versions of SQLite as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 as they did not include the vulnerable code, which was introduced in a later version of the package.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: Use-after-free in fts3EvalNextRow in ext/fts3/fts3.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in the virtual table implementation of SQLite. This flaw allows an attacker who can execute SQL statements to rename a virtual table to the name of one of its shadow tables, leading to potential data corruption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: Virtual table can be renamed into the name of one of its shadow tables
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: Virtual table can be renamed into the name of one of its shadow tables

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the matchinfo auxiliary function of the SQLite FTS3 extension module. This flaw allows an attacker who can execute SQL statements to crash the application, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: NULL pointer dereference in ext/fts3/fts3_snippet.c via a crafted matchinfo() query
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw did not affect the versions of SQLite as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 as they did not include the vulnerable code, which was introduced in a later version of the package.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: NULL pointer dereference in ext/fts3/fts3_snippet.c via a crafted matchinfo() query
